body_html:
@khanrc

I ran the code in your jupyter notebook with one GPU and got the following:

Train Epoch: 0 [0/60000 (0%)]   Loss: 2.299733
collected 10
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
total collected 35

Those numbers aren't as large as the ones in your notebook so I'm curious what you think about that. As apaszke mentioned, if you create cycles in your data structures you get more objects the garbage collector will collect.

body:
@khanrc 

I ran the code in your jupyter notebook with one GPU and got the following:
```
Train Epoch: 0 [0/60000 (0%)]   Loss: 2.299733
collected 10
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
collected 5
[]
total collected 35
```
Those numbers aren't as large as the ones in your notebook so I'm curious what you think about that. As apaszke mentioned, if you create cycles in your data structures you get more objects the garbage collector will collect.
